channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: The Financial Times is making coverage of the war in Ukraine free. https://t.co/BXKhUpOmSr
Russia Deploys Mobile Crematoriums. https://t.co/bbXXAtRJ1l
GOP Leaders Try to Ignore Trump on Ukraine. https://t.co/BGS3tIMPAz
Russian invasion of Ukraine throws world into new era of upheaval. https://t.co/g1KMKVHb0Q
The red state Senate race where loyalty to Trump is proving costly. #utah https://t.co/Mguz9PmBYo
We invaded Iraq with as little provocation as Putin has for invading Ukraine. Which led to this charming moment. https://t.co/6uu9vm57vG
@dsearls The sanctions aren't his nightmare -- I think this is. https://t.co/yvZyOen97m
Video of bombs dropping in Ukraine. https://t.co/EGfua9fmg8
Russia's Putin announces military operation in Ukraine. https://t.co/b80n1hClfg
Ukrainian President Zelensky says Putin has ordered invasion as country prepares for war. https://t.co/JmYzgsHHDi

Putin is so clever, but this is just the beginning of his war, when presumably his generals and troops are all gung ho. Maybe they'll even take Kyiv. And Putin can have a Mission Accomplished moment. Then what? ðŸ˜€ https://t.co/CPSaIXMwLJ

Another thought. The web and Linux has never had the system-level scripting we had on the Mac 25 years ago. Apple, just like the music industry with Napster, couldn't think of anything to do but crush it. Didn't fit in with their philosophy. We'll try it again.

Of course people would pay for music. Napster did in one year what the music industry on its own would never have done. I kept saying -- people are talking about music in the supermarket for crying out loud! We'd pay anything for this. https://t.co/jZBSJRohQO

We had a few days of spring, everything melted, it was in the 60s today but here comes winter again. Expecting a foot of snow tomorrow night and into Friday. Speaking for myself only, I'm ready for winter to be over.
Kaepernick Launching Initiative for Free Secondary Autopsies for â€˜Police-Relatedâ€™ Deaths. https://t.co/7gyXzau5fK
@howardweaver yes of course
Why are teachers quitting? https://t.co/6aphYshbu9
Prosecutors Leading Trump Fraud Investigation in NY Resign. https://t.co/Mb762jU2wW

The NYT should have a public editor. Probably a few. 1. They should only be copy edited. What they write is up to them. 2. Their work appears alongside the op-ed columnists, same prominence. 3. They must *not* be journalists, but must be good/great writers, and news users.
Why this has a chance of working?
1. The journalists will have to read it, because it gets the same distribution they do.
2. The writers have no reason to tiptoe around journalists because they don't care about access, and aren't trying to protect a career in journalism.
3. They come into the job with no fixed ideas on how journalism works. They view things only from the readers' perspective.
Even so they are vastly outnumbered by the people writing for the NYT who are trying to keep careers going and do care about access.

Very nice juxtaposition illustrating the horrific disconnect between reality and Democrats. On one side you have an "American" political party that's aligned with monster Putin, and on the other you a party that's committed to lowering inflation (they can't) etc. https://t.co/kfuRKcqLns
Twitter $uper Follows. https://t.co/f06iWv4OlA
Do you smoke marijuana?

@mjedrysiak yes -- the second german invasion (after austria) was czechoslavakia, under the pretense that the german-speaking people in sudetenland were being mistreated. after that germany stopped with the pretenses and just invaded countries blitzkrieg style.
@Creech yes i know that. ;-) so what did you answer?
